channel.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
channel.description:
[i][b]Have you ever wondered what would the Black Mesa world smell like?[/size][/b][/i]
Hello everyone, i want to open a simple amusing thread, hopefully it will get people's attention because it is realistic and fictitious.
It's about the Half Life game, or Black Mesa in general. We all know how the game [b]looks[/b], [b]feels[/b] (more or less, you don't really want to feel the zombies gutting you :S ) , [b]sounds[/b], *you can forget the [b]taste[/b]*, but the [b]smell[/b], that is something which would be interesting.
To all who don't care: !"No, this isn't a request to put a smell option in the game."! This thread is about fantasizing the smells of Black Mesa.
To start of: What do you think how would the train smell at the beginning of the game? I bet it smelled like coffee, and cologne.

item.description:
Hey, at least there’s no plant that pops up when you get near and whacks you in the nuts.
That we know of.

item.description:

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
Wow, i never thought this thread would
be this active.Thanks guys.

On topic, Xen in my mind is like a swamp.
Stale and reeking of bacteria festing on dead vegetation.On other side, not all smells in Xen should be bad.There are probably some plants that produces fruit or nuts which might smell
nice.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
It can be taken either way. It was left open to interpretation. I was referring to the chapters primarily though as Tiki indicated.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Tiki
item.description:
Oh.

Well I sure hope Gordon can’t smell the different islands from 40 feet away. They must have some stench, if that’s the case.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
True, but I thought he meant each of the little floating island platforms, not individual chapters.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Tiki
item.description:
He means that different islands will have… personalities, depending on what lives there (or where it came from). Not that each island must reek of one thing like some sort of Alien Epcot.

PERSONALLY, I THINK XEN SMELLS LIKE THE RUBBER LINING AND SWEATY FOAM INSERT OF AN HEV HELMET.

…

Please, someone make an Alien Epcot. It can feature in “Star Trek III: Out Of Darkness” or something.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I don’t see being a borderworld having anything to do with not being able to mix smells.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
danielsangeo:

My opinion of the smells of Xen would be a combination of gym socks, metallic-y copper, and an ashy smell. Not pleasant.

Enh. It’d depend on the area of Xen you’re in. Xen’s a border world E.G. a conglomerate of multiple universes. One island would smell like Headcrab while another would smell strongly of ammonia as an example.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Jake_R
item.description:
I’d like to tell you what I think the place smells like but I keep focussing on Residue Processing and then I just want to scream and run away.

Read full topic

My opinion of the smells of Xen would be a combination of gym socks, metallic-y copper, and an ashy smell. Not pleasant.

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
Now you try surviving in that environment with all those nasty smells.
I think i would barf every minute or two. <X

Sybill - zombies not dead at all?
-Don’t stink?

They would be the smelliest of them all, with the barnacle in the 2nd place.
How else would you explain all that open gut and flesh?
That it is still fresh? I doubt that.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Sybill
item.description:
Tiki:

I like to imagine that bullsquids smell strongly of ammonia.

Yes, I think that too

Gordon Freeman did not smell well hahahahahaha in that suit, sweating and going through all those stinking places

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Tiki
item.description:
I like to imagine that bullsquids smell strongly of ammonia.

Houndeyes, like butter.

Barnacles, like halitosis.

I have no idea what Headcrabs would smell like. Actually, I just got an idea, but it’s not G-rated.

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Sybill
item.description:
I think in the area of offices should smell detergent. But there are also areas of toxic waste that should smell a strong chemical.
That if, should smell like shit Chapter waste treatment.
The zombies of black table, are not dead at all. I do not think stink. Even if they smell blood.
Stinky monsters must be bullsquid and bernacle

Read full topic

item.title: The Smells of Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
danielsangeo:
raw_bean:

This thread smells like someone with too much free time on their hands.

Johnwalter:

To hell with it.
Lock thread please.

I’ll allow it for now. But I’m moving it to the Ladies Club since it doesn’t have to do with Black Mesa or its development. Forum rules will still apply to this thread.

I posted it there because i thought it goes there.
I did not mean to abuse any forum rules.

Tiki
I was curious how would the Xen species blood and flesh smell.Yes, it would probably reek as similar as our,
but maybe it could have some acid in it, or flesh eating enzyme.Man, how bad the smell might be when you
stand in front of a zombie.

Read full topic
